I'm thinking the genius who figured this all out is a graduate of Dover, PA public schools. 
 
 He shows original thinking, a sign of his education. At least, I never heard of the theory. Well, not exactly a theory, more like Biblical Truth.:) 
 
 
"Then the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one who found him would kill him" (Genesis 4:15).
 
 I believe, and the only thing that makes sense, is that the mark that God put on Cain was to slope his forehead back. That way Cain would not look different from the Neanderthal people, and they would accept him and he could live among them.

 
 So Cain was made to look like a Neanderthal so he could live among them, so God could kill them in the Flood, understand? Well, the writer hasn't quite worked through that problem yet but I have no doubt he will set his mind to it.

But I already pointed out the mark of Cain in another thread.
 
 http://www.4forums.com/political/showpost.php?p=185957&postcount=1
 
 You see, this particular gene has but two alleles. One exists in the majority of humans. That allele, along with several other genes involved in pigmentation create people with various shades of brown to very brown skin. The second allele was created by a more recent mutation and spread in a more limited population. That allele produces white skin.

beervolcano

But Neanderthals lived in icy Ice Age Europe and most likely had pale skin.
 
 This is reminescent of Nahmanides (Nachamnides):
 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creationism
 
Also, relatively old Kabbalistic sources from well before the scientifically apparent age of the universe was first determined are in close concord with modern scientific estimates of the age of the universe, according to Rabbi Aryeh Kaplan. Other interesting parallels are brought down from, among other sources, Nachmanides, who expounds exegetically that there was a Neanderthal-like species with which Adam mated (he did this long before Neanderthals had even been discovered scientifically).

 
 This type of Kabalistic review of Genesis is also touted by Gerald Schroder:
 http://www.ncseweb.org/resources/rncse_content/vol18/7229_ithe_science_of_godi_by_g_12_30_1899.asp
 
Schroeder admits that there were "pre-Adamites" (Cro-Magnon and Neanderthals) living for 40 000 years prior to Adam, but questions the existence of earlier hominid species because of the fragmentary nature of their fossils.
